Pre-Game Insights: Wales are coming off the back of a 4-0 hammering at the hands of Slovakia, and a 0-0 draw with Gibraltar, with their last feel-good moment being a 4-1 win over Finland in their Euro 2024 play-off semi-final.
Turkey's most recent game was a 2-1 loss to the Netherlands in the quarter-final of Euro 2024, and they will be looking to build on their momentum after reaching the quarter-finals of the tournament.

Wales will be without Dan James, Wes Burns, and Nathan Broadhead due to injuries, while Turkey will be missing Ferdi Kadıoğlu, Ahmetcan Kaplan, Yunus Akgün, Bertug Yildirim, and Merih Demiral due to various reasons.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales are unbeaten in their last five home games, excluding penalty shootouts.
Turkey are coming into this match on a high following their best tournament performance in over 15 years, and they will be looking to continue their upward trajectory in the Nations League.
The match will be televised live to all UK viewers on SC4.
Others: The new Welsh manager Craig Bellamy is relatively inexperienced as a manager, and this lack of experience brings both uncertainty and a sense of optimism.
The departure of key players like Gareth Bale and Joe Allen has left a void in both experience and leadership in the Welsh squad.
Turkey's young forward Mustafa Hekimoğlu is seen as one of the brightest talents in Turkish football, and he will be looking to make an impact in the match.
